title: Floral tributes paid to Mahatma Gandhi
text:
Tribune Reporters
Mandi, October 2
Members of various social, religious and political organisations, officials of the district administration and different government departments and school students today took out a procession to mark Gandhi Jayanti in the town. After passing through various markets, the procession culminated at Gandhi Chowk, where they paid floral tributes to Mahatma Gandhi. Additional Deputy Commissioner Rigved Thakur garlanded the statue of Mahatma Gandh on the behalf of the district administration. Later, a ‘sarvdharam sabha’ was organised at Gandhi Bhawan. The ADC said Mahatma Gandhi was a worshiper of truth and non-violence and sanitation was very dear to him. Swachhta Abhiyan begins
SUNDERNAGAR: The Rotary Club today launched Swachata Abhiyan from Bhojpur in Sundernagar. According to CP Kaushal, president of the club, said it had identified different spots where banners were displayed appealing to the masses to use dustbins for the disposal of the garbage. Volunteers of the club took part in the campaign. The drive has been launched to make the masses aware of the need of disposal of waste. The volunteers distributed pamphlets by involving a large number of residents. Rajiv Kumar, SDM, Girija Gautam, president, MC, Ved Prakash, tehsildar, Tulinder Bitta, Municipal Councillor, Bhojpur ward, Rampal Gupta, secretary of the club, and large number of members of the club and residents also took part in the campaign. Cleanliness drive
CHAMBA: The local rehri-phadi union organised a cleanliness drive on the occasion of Gandhi Jayanti here today. The drive was led by the union president Rijhu Ram. Speaking on the occasion, Rijhu said the activists cleansed the local Chaugan. He appealed to the public that the campaign was aimed at raising awareness and civic responsibility among the masses. He called upon the citizens to celebrate Gandhi Jayanti as cleanliness day.
